dataset.title: MCR LTER: Coral Reef: Community Dynamics: Juvenile Coral Density from 2005, ongoing

abstract.para: These data describe the density (colonies per quadrat of 0.5 x 0.5 m size) of juvenile corals on the fringing reefs and outer reef (10 m depth) of Moorea. Beginning in 2005, surveys are completed annually at LTER 1 and 2 in the austral autumn (April-May). Addition event-motivated sampling began in 2011 with additional sites from the other two shores of Moorea surveyed and surveys at LTER 1 and 2 repeated in August; these surveys will likely continue for 1-2 years but will not become a maintained component of the annual sampling. The focus is on juvenile corals defined as individuals less than or equal to 40 mm diameter. These data include juvenile scleractinian corals and juvenile Millepora spp. (Class: Hydrozoa; Order Hydroida, Sub Order Anthomedusae, Family Milleporidae). These transects are co-located with annual photographic surveys and, therefore, broad community descriptors are also available.

keywordSet.keyword: Richard B. Gump South Pacific Research Station

intellectualRights.para:
Data collected under the auspices of the MCR LTER are available to the public after primary publication, or at most two years after the completion of the study unless proprietary restrictions are warranted. Use of MCR LTER data is subject to acceptance of the following conditions:
1. The user agrees to provide valid name and contact information prior to downloading online data. This information will be used to contact the user in case of changes to the data, and may also be used by data set authors and MCR LTER project administrators to document data usage.
2. The user agrees to cite the data set author and MCR LTER in all publications in which the data are used, as per the instructions in the data documentation. If no specific instructions are provided in the data documentation, the user is requested to include the following statement: "Data sets were provided by the Moorea Coral Reef Ecosystem LTER, funded by the US National Science Foundation (OCE-0417412)."
3. The user agrees to provide one copy of any manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the data set author prior to submitting it for publication.
4. The user agrees to send two hard copies of any published manuscript based on MCR LTER data to the following address: Dr. Andrew J. Brooks Deputy Program Director, MCR LTER Marine Science Institute University of California Santa Barbara, CA 93106-6150 The user also agrees to send one electronic copy (pdf format) to the following e-mail address: brooks@msi.ucsb.edu
5. Users are prohibited from selling or redistributing any data provided by MCR LTER without explicit prior permission.
6. Users are encouraged to contact original investigators responsible for data. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on MCR LTER data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original investigators.
7. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and the MCR LTER will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.
8. Any violation of the terms of this agreement will result in immediate forfeiture of the data and loss of access privileges to other MCR LTER data sets.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: LTER 1 polygon including LTER 0 on north shore

description.para: This is an ongoing dataset. Data are added every year.

section.title: Juvenile coral survey design
section.para:
The surveys for juvenile corals are completed in situ using 0.5 x 0.5 m quadrats positioned along the same 40 m long transects used for the photographic analysis of benthic community structure. Surveys are completed by two SCUBA divers, and involve careful inspection of the substratum for small corals that are sexual recruits (typically circular in outline with no fractured surfaces) rather than fragments (typically broken pieces that are not attached to the benthos). Juvenile corals are defined as individuals less than or equal to 40 mm diameter.
Juvenile Millepora spp. (Class: Hydrozoa; Order Hydroida, Sub Order Anthomedusae, Family Milleporidae) and juvenile scleractinian corals are identified to genus level in most cases.

section.title: Survey frequency
section.para: These surveys began in 2005 and are repeated annually in April or May. In 2011 the survey was repeated in August (for only the LTER 1 and 2 Forereef 10 m transects.)

section.title: Survey sites
section.para: In most years, transects are all on the north shore of Moorea, at LTER 1 and LTER 2 in the fringing reef and the forereef habitat at 10 meters depth. In April 2011 the survey was extended to additional locations: southeast and southwest shores at LTER sites 4 and 6, respectively, on the forereef habitat at 10 m depth.

section.title: Reference for taxonomy
section.para: Veron JEN (2000) Corals of the World - Volumes 1, 2, 3. Australian Institute of Marine Science, Townsville, Australia. 1382pp

Department of Biological Sciences, California State University

funding.para: NSF (LTER) MCR I #OCE-0417412, MCR II #OCE-1026851, and MCR IIb #OCE-1236905

dataTable.entityDescription: Counts of juvenile corals identified to genus at each quadrat. This is Type I table allowing public access data table.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Nominal year of observation.
Day of Observation; Moorea local date.
Location including site and habitat.
Identfier label of quadrat in juvenile survey.

textDomain.definition: An integer from 1 to 40 as text. Each transect has 40 quadrats.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Location name of equivalent quadrat in photo survey contains site, habitat, pole span and quadrat.

textDomain.definition: LTER # HABITAT Coral Transect Pole #-# Quadrat #

attribute.attributeDefinition: Whether this photoquadrat was taken that year and is in the catalog.

codeDefinition.definition: True: This photo is in the catalog.
False: This photo was not taken, or is not in the catalog yet. (If more than a year past, it was not taken. Photos began in 2006.) Photos are in April so no photos for the August surveys.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Genus or alternate taxonomic identifier
Count of juvenile corals. (Colonies per quadrat of 0.5 x 0.5 m size)

missingValueCode.codeExplanation: Not available. In rare cases the quadrat does not fit on the transect.

attribute.attributeDefinition: Initials of SCUBA divers.

codeDefinition.definition: Hollie Kerr+Mairead Maheigan; synonymous with HK+MEM

attribute.attributeDefinition: Season as nominal month representing time of year of the survey. See codes definitions.

codeDefinition.definition: April or May, austral autumn, usual time of survey
August, austral late winter, few surveys at this time starting in 2011

dataTable.entityName: Juvenile coral count annual time-series most-recent
dataTable.entityDescription: Counts of juvenile corals identified to genus at each quadrat. This is Type II data requiring an MCR account to access the data table.

online.onlineDescription: This is a restricted data table (LTER Network Type II) containing most-recent data. Access with MCR internal account login only until released. Data may be made available through arrangement with the dataset owner.
